Comments_List: The class revolved mostly around research and studying folktales, both of which worked to develop a larger vocabulary.

I continued to develop my skills in reading, writing, speaking, and listening to modern Greek, but also applied those skills more analytically than in previous courses.  I appreciated learning about literature, poetry, and folk tales throughout the course.
Learned Advanced Modern Greek grammar and vocabulary and practiced speaking as well.

The content of this course was excellent, and the class discussions were always interesting and usually helpful in reinforcing that content.  However, sometimes these discussions would degenerate into English, which detracted from the overall purpose of the course.
I would recommend this course to any student interesting in studying Greek.
Modern Greek is secretly the best language at Yale.
